locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the reality of the devil/evil, the necessity of imagination in faith, the nature of the church as a called community, and the inevitability of suffering in resistance.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Utilizes scholarly commentaries (Harink, Selwyn) and theological heavyweights (Barth, Hauerwas) to ground the text in its historical and cosmic context.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily 'talks about' the necessity of resistance and the nature of the church, moving into 'promising' only through the quotation of the biblical text itself.
voorbeelden: The Christian life is a call to resistance.
The New Testament does not present arguments...

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To instill a sense of cosmic awareness and courage for ethical/spiritual resistance in the hearer.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentioned in the opening prayer/quote, but less active in the sermon's own rhetorical structure.

voorbeelden: The New Testament does not present arguments.
The glory of God is a very strong theme.
This sermon is about a month ahead of its time.
Remember that when you are called to the barricades.
I have often recalled the cover of Time.
I particularly remember one bit of that book.
I don’t know how much we think about the glory.
God... will himself restore, establish, and strengthen you.
The promised future that is guaranteed to us.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from the text rather than spoken as a direct 'I promise you on behalf of God' by the preacher.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher acts as a commentator/teacher rather than a mandatory agent of a reality-changing word.

indicatoren: Extensive use of third-person anecdotes (Dallaire, King, Stott).
Describing the 'strange new world of the Bible' rather than entering it.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a theological lecture rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Present-tense address of God's action now
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information about resistance is gained, but the power to resist is not sacramentally 'bestowed'.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Passive and quoted. The preacher points to the promise in the text rather than 'handing' it to the congregation.
voorbeelden: The God of all grace... will himself restore, establish, and strengthen you.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Mostly 'I' (the preacher's memories) or 'We' (general Christian experience).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used mostly in the final section and when quoting the Bible.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Weak. Often used to describe a hypothetical situation ('You will recognize it').

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths and descriptions of the letter.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Theology of the devil/church) -> Directive (You must resist).
voorbeelden: The church resists... because of the call... Your calling is to discern the place of resistance.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is treated as a fact to be known rather than a power to be received before the command.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Resist him... knowing that the same experience of suffering is required.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a high-level theological essay on the theme of resistance. It provides excellent intellectual categories but remains largely constative.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Analysis of the 'roaring lion' as Gestapo-like irrational prejudice.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a vivid mental framework for understanding evil.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The preacher quotes the promise at the end rather than speaking it.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The preacher remains a reporter of God's promises rather than an ambassador delivering them.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an 'event' of learning, but not necessarily a sacramental 'event' of encounter.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'Creative Word' (Declarative) that changes the hearer's status.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the sentences, but the preacher is the narrator.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts more as a 'commender' of the text than a mandatory.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's imagination/discernment.
tekstueel_bewijs: This sort of imagination needs nurturing in the church.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as a 'reflection' on grace rather than a 'means' of grace.
tekstueel_bewijs: The first epistle of Peter is a letter from a God’s-eye view.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The God of all grace... will himself restore, establish, and strengthen you.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, the God of all grace is here to restore you, to establish you, and to strengthen you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a future-tense description to a present-tense performative event.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in a quote at the very end.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the promise of Christ's presence into the call to resistance.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because you are baptized, you already share in the victory over this lion.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'The church' and not enough 'You'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the congregation directly as the 'family of brothers and sisters'.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, here in Ontario, are being called to the barricades.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The command to resist feels heavy because the indicative of grace is treated as information.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Make the indicative a declarative gift first.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: Theologically rich and intellectually stimulating, but needs more 'illocutionary fire' to move from a lecture to a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the preacher isn't just 'sending a message' about the devil, but failing to 'perform' the defeat of the devil through the Word.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: While rhetorically sound (good stories), SAT shows the lack of specific speech acts (Commissives) that create faith.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'Constative Surplus' (talking about the God's-eye view) actually prevents the hearer from experiencing that view.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Christian life is a call to resistance.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Good for teaching, weak for empowering.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the authority of others (Harink, Dallaire, Stott) which reinforces the constative/descriptive nature of the discourse.
